review.title: Vintage hotel meticulously maintained

I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. I really loved this hotel. The lobby was really nice and I loved all the decor. Also loved that they allow pets. Only downside is that there was no place to take her to go to the bathroom.

Awesome hotel, much better than expected. Clean room, comfortable bed, friendly staff (who even called after we got into the room to check on how we liked the room and if there was anything that we needed).

Only con was the lack of parking.  Not enough parking for the rooms that they have.

review.title: Close to airport

Good transportation by bus to shopping mass with a good selection of food court that you could spent the whole afternoon. Good Bart train from there to Union Square for sightseeing etc. There is a 50% discount for senior for bus transportation.

However, room was tiny and cramped and the walls were paper thin.  Had a barking dog in the next room and thank god it went to sleep late at night.  Not the worst hotel experience, but not the best.

review.title: Faucet leaking h20, utensils were dirty.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: We discovered black hairs in our bed around 10 pm  and promptly called the front desk. They said that there was no one on duty that could change the bed for us but offered to deliver sheets to our room  for us to change them. No apology was made by the girl who brought them.  The next morning I told staff at the front desk, and the manager was very apologetic and nice about it. They ended up taking a small amount off of our room charge.

review.title: Excellent place to stay near the airport
review.reviewText: I was just there for a night but had to make an additional trip back and forth to the airport to meet an incoming flight. The desk staff arranged the shuttle and were extremely helpful. The room was spotless and I found the facility to be very quiet!  I would definitely stay there again when I have a VERY EARLY flight out of SFO.

review.title: Convenient to Airport
review.reviewText:
Rather than driving from Sonoma area though the city of San Francisco during rush hour, we opted to drop our rental car and stay near the airport so we could catch our morning flight.  The hotel shuttle was convenient and on time, so we made it through check-in and TSA with time to spare...

The room was clean and had everything we needed:  small fridge, coffee maker, etc.  Self-serve breakfast was also good, except for a couple of kids with parents that had no control...

While we didn't use them, the other hotel amenities (pool, sauna, etc.) looked to be well maintained for guest's use.

review.title: Problems with airport shuttle
review.reviewText:
1. Hotel is 10 minutes from the airport 
2. You have to call the hotel to tell them to send the shuttle.  It. Does not keep coming by the pick up point on its own.
3. At 11:30 PM it took 50 minutes from the time I called the hotel and asked them to send the shuttle until it showed up.. Several additional calls were answered with "It will be there in a few minutes. 
4. Hotel was fine otherwise
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service

review.title: Great hotel and staff

Wonderful staff, who accommodated our needs for airport shuttle, suggestions of SF acitivities when asked. 
To offer us a light breakfast in the lobby at 3:30 am before our shuttle arrived was an unexpected treat. Sarah at the desk was exceptional in courtesy!

review.title: Two night stay near San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: We arrived late, 10pm. The shuttle just happened to be at the airport picking others up, and we found the last seats. Shuttle goes to several hotels. Our room with a King bed was ready and waiting. The first morning, we almost missed breakfast. There were no eggs left, but the attendant said (with a smile) that she'd scramble us some. They were hot and greatly appreciated. We did need to walk about a mile to the BART station for our trip into San Francisco, but there were no problems getting there and back. The next morning, the shuttle arrived after stopping at other hotels first. However, it still got us to the airport in just 15min.  Such sevice with friendly, smiling, and helpful people!!!!  If I ever use SFO I will stay at this LaQuinta.  In fact, I'll be staying at other LaQuintas in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly, helpful people.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs to have the window in the shower removed.  The shower/tub needs a non-slip mat!!
review.locationRemarks: There are lots of restaurants within an easy walk. Close to the train, but no noise.  Close to the airport, but no noise.

Needless to say not a restful night's sleep.

The shuttle service was prompt, the drivers polite and helpful.  Hotel staff were more than friendly.  We would definitely go back again for this price...very good value!

review.title: I would recommend this to others
review.reviewText:
I attended an event at a different hotel which was very expensive. My husband & I found La Quinta online and the price was excellent (especially for the location). The suite came with a full kitchen, bathroom, living 'area' and nice and comfortable king size bed (and decent size TV). We also discovered that they allow pets to stay at no extra cost or fee/deposit (good to know in the future).
We were offered a lovely complementary breakfast, which was included in the stay.
Check-out was at noon - no hurrying!
The only draw-back I would note is that the walls are not terribly thick. You can hear people walking above (on the walkway), and doors being closed loudly (depends who your 'neighbors' are I suppose). If you are a light sleeper, I probably would not recommend staying there.
There is also a nice swimming pool for the warmer summer months.
review.positiveRemarks: Please see above

review.reviewText:
The shuttle bus is on-demand which is fine except that the staff tell you it will be no more than 30 mins; I asked for a more precise window so as to be able to go back inside the airport lounge to wait but was told that was not possible and that "if I did not like it, I could catch a taxi".

In the end, the wait was 20 mins.

review.title: Total Comfort and Upscale Design
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at this La Quinta.  The room design was upscale and the bed was incredibly plush.  Best night's sleep I've had in awhile, which was important because we arrived very late and I had an early morning departure from SFO.  We brought our dog along and were pleased with the courtyard and doggie-friendly areas for his walk.  Front desk and maintenance staff were friendly and attentive.  The garage and elevator could use upgrading, but considering the excellent room rate, that's easily overlooked.  We had a great stay and will definitely be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, upscale lobby and room design, beautiful courtyard and pool area.

review.title: Good location but noisy
review.reviewText: Stayed there overnight to catch a flight. Shuttle from airport took a long time, mostly because it is shared with other hotels that get served first. Hotel room itself was fine, but nearby rooms and corridors were noisy on a Saturday night. The central court arrangement does not help in that regard. Had to use sleeping mask and ear plugs. Shower curtain was also surprisingly short and unwieldy. Room was quite expensive, due to location. Overall not impressed.

It is clean, the people are helpful and nice, and there were places to walk to in order to eat the night before.  We used this hotel again on our return through San Francisco.  I would use them again.

review.title: Affordable and near San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, decent hotel. Clean room, off street parking, restaurants in walking distance. Good variety in their complementary breakfast.

review.title: Everything I Needed
review.reviewText: Stayed one night in this hotel, with business meetings earlier in the day and the next morning. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and check-in and check-out were both easy and fast. The room was clean, large, quiet, and equipped with everything I needed except for a clothes brush, which I would recommend adding. The concierges helped me with restaurant directions and a computer to check my email, as well as information about BART. No complaints--I would recommend to others and would stay there again.

review.title: Potentially nice Inn, What, no Pool?!!!!
review.reviewText: Since we had called days ahead of time, requesting that our last accommodations in 3 weeks be located in the back, away from the noisy San Francisco International Airport/busy main road, we would have appreciated being alerted that the outdoor pool repainting/cement recoating was already in progress upon our arrival. The Epoxy paint used created such strong, noxious fumes that permeated throughout every corridor and into our room, when the door was opened. Besides having the pool area off limits in such abnormally hot weather, we were virtually room bound. The redeeming qualities were that there was a much needed coin operated washer/dryer, microwVe, refrig and comfy beds. The bathroom, however, was the smallest in size of the 9 places we slept in and only had  small single vanity, with little room for cosmetics. Please tell your patrons the next time you're having construction projects scheduled and at least offer some compensation for facilities unusable like a much needed pool in 90+ degree weather!
review.positiveRemarks: the beds and washer/dryer
review.negativeRemarks: tell patrons when construction is due
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. We slept good both nights, the bed was very comfortable. Employees were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was good and there was plenty. The courtyard was so nice. Had morning  coffee while enjoying the paper and the hummingbirds. We will stay here again.

review.title: Great Staff but Room Disapoointing
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for one night since it was very close to airport. Our flight was at 6am and we had to return rental car. The hotel did not have our reservation from Expedia but the staff was very helpful. When we got to the room, there were steps to our door. It was odd but since my fiance was with me, he carried the luggage up. I would have had to drag it up the steps. The bed was comfortable but the rest of the room old and  tacky. One side of sofa was so low like someone sat in that spot for 30 years. Cabinets, tables and dressers looked like furniture in my college dorm room from the 70's. Since we only needed room for one night, we did not complain. Room served the purpose but I won't stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed

I chose this hotel because of it's easy access to SF and it's pet policy - no extra fee for the animal and no cleaning deposit.  The rooms and the common areas are all kept clean and tidy.  The courtyard area with it's stylish seating areas was particularly comfortable and easy to access.  I also liked that the parking was underground with an elevator to all floors.

I will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends.

review.reviewText: clean, quiet and comfortable; nice courtyard, though the rainy weather didn't allow us to use it.

review.title: Clean and very comfortable
review.reviewText: Staff friendly, quick to please as we were leaving very early and still let us into the breakfast room for coffee and snacks prior to our early leave.  Nice location, great facility.  Helped us in all our needs, wake-up call, shuttle service and polite and courteous service.
review.positiveRemarks: Design, comfort and cleanliness

review.reviewText: This is a good place to stay, clean, comfortable, close to SF Airport. No complaints at all. For the price, there is probably not a better airport restaurant.

review.reviewText: Coffe maker didn't work, water shot out of sink and soaked both of us in our only pair of pjs. Van pickup was 1 hr after call.

Inspite of the snacks, still would stay again.  Good price, friendly staff.  Close to airport but not too close to hear jets overhead.
review.positiveRemarks: Outdoor pool.  Very clean.  Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade quality of evening appetizers or discontinue.  Rubbery fish sticks and chicken finger snacks very "unappetizing".

review.title: California never again

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the airport but not noisy.
review.reviewText:
We had originally intended to drive into the centre of San Francisco but found that to be an ill advised plan due to a shortage of parking places and the cost of parking. Instead we booked the hotel shuttle back to the airport in the morning and caught the BART train to Powell Street.
At the end of the day we caught the same train back to the airport and called for the hotel shuttle to return us to the hotel. If you are a pensioner, buy your BART ticket at the airport enquiries desk. You get a very useful discount on your ticket. Tickets bought from automatic ticket vendors cannot give discounts.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel, not very expensive being ten miles out of the centre of interest. But see above.
review.negativeRemarks: It is a pity that the airport shuttle could not drop hotel guests at the BART station just up the road, rather than the tour around he local hotels.

review.title: Good, and convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel is a pleasant looking property, and in a good location on El Camino Real. It's quite close to SFO, so you can check out and be at the airport in 15 min or less, depending on traffic. The rooms are comfortable, and the off-street parking easily accessible by elevator. If you want a bigger room to spread out in, get the 2-Queen bed room. The King room is smaller. I have been in both the past two years. My gripe about my King room this week was the tiny bathroom, and the dim lights. I believe saving on electric, too, but the lights in my room were underpowered, especially in the bathroom, which had lighting more appropriate to a bar than a hotel room.

review.title: Avoid the Hotel Shuttle and take a Taxi !
review.reviewText:
So here how it goes. If you are returning a car to the SFO airport there will be 4 stops from the rental drop off area to Terminal 1 on the Airport Tram. You then have to call the hotel for a pickup at one of the 4 terminals so this could be up to another 3 or 4 more stops depending on what terminal you pick up the shuttle from. This is kind of annoying but it gets worse. The Shuttle then stops at numerous hotels along the way and at each hotel the shuttle bus brings individuals to their individual rooms so there are added stops and delays to ultimately get you to the La Quninta hotel. So with all of this stopping what is approximately a 5-7 minute ride by taxi may take up to an hour and half plus by free shuttle. Ouch! Not very nice when you need to catch an early flight the next morning. In my opinion it is worth the $32 round trip by taxi versus sitting on a bus up to 3 hours round trip.

The good news is the hotel was pleasant and clean when we arrived and the rates were very reasonable. The staff also seemed very nice and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Earlier breakfast accommodations for those catching early morning flights. Breakfast starts at 6:00AM too late for early flights.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport for for next morning early flights. Too built up for seeing anything pretty.

review.title: Nice hotel but a little bit scarry
review.reviewText:
Night staff was not friendly. I was awakened by screaming and swearing from someone in a nearby room at 2 am and then someone attempted to enter my room.
The morning staff was very friendly and they had good coffee and complimentary fruit. The free airport shuttle was very convenient.

review.title: Thin walls
review.reviewText: We just needed a place close to the airport for one night. After traveling 10 hours, we got in exhausted around 11:30 pm. The experience was so colored by our neighbors, it's hard to rate the room. The couple yelled from the time we arrived until 2:00 am, had an international call on speaker (yelling) finally slept and then started yelling again at 5:00am. They could have been standing right next to us it was so loud. Without sleep, we happily packed up by 6:00am.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was nice, nice staff on evening and morning shifts, and the free breakfast was a pleasant surprise.
review.negativeRemarks: Let people know if the room they are getting has an adjoining door. That may have been part of the sound problem but they were just non-stop loud.
review.locationRemarks: Everything was closed by the time we got there by taxi. The staff offered to give us phone numbers for late-night delivery.

review.title: Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: If you want a hotel with shuttle this is the place. Very nice room, breakfast and easy shuttle to airport. Be sure you take the shuttle at least 2 hours before take off as the shuttle is shared with other hotels in the area. Hotel staff was great.

review.title: Great place to stay...
review.reviewText: It was near the airport and still close enough to the sights in SF. The room we reserved had a full kitchen, but the front desk staff accommodated us when we asked to switch to the room with the Jacuzzi tub. Nice! There probably needs to be some kind of divider between the tub and the bed area because the tub steamed up the room, but it was a very nice addition for our stay! Only issue was that the window in our room didn't lock, which made me a bit nervous about intruders since the room was on the first floor (note to La Quinta to please fix the window lock!). We didn't make it down in time for breakfast so can't comment on the quality of the food, but I'm sure it would have been a decent start to a day!

review.title: There are better places to stay
review.reviewText:
We paid extra for a room with a kitchen to be able to prepare our own food rather than eat in restaurants every night. We got a kitchen but could not use it because the only utensils we got were two knives, forks and tea spoons, plus a small saucepan with no lid and a large soup pot which was useless unless you wanted to make soup. I asked for some utensils and received a dirty frypan. Still no cooking implements which renders the kitchen useless!
Even if one could use the kitchen there was nothing to put in the dishwasher and no other washing up gear of any sort to hand wash used items.
Breakfast was a debacle! The hotel was quite full and the small room was full of people wanting breakfast at about 8;00. Only thing was the cook had run out of eggs and all that was left as a hot breakfast was bacon and fried potato which was cold. When asked about the lack her reply was "I'm getting it!" but all that came was some cold fried potato....It was obviously too much for her to handle and she closed the breakfast room 15 minutes early and put up a note to deter those who came toward the end of the allotted time. Some came in for coffee and toast anyway so she closed the door and put a garbage bin inside it to further deter the more determined. My wife and I made a few suggestions to the front desk but got the usual "Put it in the suggestion box" response.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean and well located near the airport
review.negativeRemarks: No gear to use the kitchen we had paid extra to have.

review.title: Good Hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText:
We stayed at La Quinta for 2 nights.

We arrived at 7:00pm and the check-in process was easy and quick. We were given a room in the third floor. The person at the reception desk explained how to log into their Wi-Fi network and the breakfast hours. She was very efficient but not particularly friendly. She also gave us the parking permit so we could use their underground parking (free).

The park spaces are good and it was easy to maneuver our car (an SUV).

The room was very clean and even the carpet seemed well maintained. The shower and water pressure was good. The only complain is the ac. It is a little loud and it is hard to find the right adjustment (for heating).

The breakfast is good considering the price. It has some hot items and a waffle machine. Yogurt, bananas and different types of pastry are also available.

The Wi-Fi speed is average. We could work OK but we've seen better speeds on other hotels.

Drive to San Francisco is easy but it can take from 25 to 40 depending on traffic.

Pricewise I would say: it is OK. The amenities and the size of the room is worth the money.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: very good stay at the hotel, it was a little bit to noisy for us (planes and loud guests)

review.title: Average hotel, above average experience
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect for a short term stay that won't break your budget. We found it to be comfortable but not fancy, and used it for a one night layover between a long flight and a long drive. Rooms were average (as expected from a chain hotel) but clean and well-maintained, and the hotel's breakfast bar had both hot and cold foods, a welcome change from the basic continental breakfast offered in many chain hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful, adding to our positive experience. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable, comfortable chain hotel close to SFO and within reasonable driving distance to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, comfort, breakfast, staff.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO, reasoanable drive to San Francisco

review.title: Reasonable for short business travel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location for getting to the airport quickly, and the staff was extremely nice and friendly. It is not the cleanest of hotels, though, and the walls are relatively thin. I found it acceptable for a quick night before a late night/early morning flight, but I would not recommend an extended stay at that hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly, and there is an airport shuttle that picks up every half hour.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls were very thin; I was very fortunate to have unexciting neighbors.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to SFO with a short shuttle ride to get there.

review.title: Ok

review.title: Clean and friendly
review.reviewText: We booked our room over the internet and got a pretty good deal. The Staff we're very friendly and helpful. The Free shuttle to and from the airport was great. Also the Shuttle Driver Was very Knowledgeable of the area and friendly to talk to. Our only small gripe was we could hear the Outside traffic. We only Stayed one night and so it wasn't a big deal.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText:
Overall, the hotel served my needs and intent of my stay. I had to overnight in San Fran to catch an early flight. The hotel was clean, quiet, and close to the airport. There were restaurants within walking distance and food delivery services available. The bed was comfortable and the internet was slow. Not a big deal though.

One thing I'd like to highlight is the courtesy airport shuttle. Even though the service is free, a reservation is required. I didn't have a reservation when I landed, but I was able to make it to the hotel problem-free. However, I made sure to make one on my trip back to the airport. Also, the shuttle services more than one hotel so be sure to factor that into your travel time. I caught the 7am shuttle and made it to the airport by 0730.

review.title: Lights off - try someone else
review.reviewText: Room had not windows in the back and was in the dark corner. Worst of all - the room had timers on all the lights. The lights were constantly turning off. A real pain.

review.title: Great for the airport
review.reviewText: We were forced to stay here because we had an early morning flight, and we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very clean, the room was large, and the bed was comfortable. The shuttle service to the airport was long getting there, but early in the morning we zipped right in. For the price, a huge winner.

review.title: Not fancy, but very acceptable accommodations.
review.reviewText: I stayed for one night on the way out of town and this was a convenient and comfortable place to stay. I had no complaints and the service was fine. It's not a fancy hotel, but it is a good place to stay near the airport. I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice place.
review.reviewText: Nice place all items clean. Building is older. 4mi or so from airport.

review.title: One step above poor
review.reviewText: I was alone on business so didn't care where I stayed. This is basically at the level of an old motel six but with a kitchen. A family traveling on a budget would be fine. I would not stay here again but I am kind of a marriott type.

review.title: nice hotel for a long stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our trip to San Francisco and we were pleased with the hotel minus a couple of setbacks. We had a room with a kitchen and our fridge made an annoying sound in the middle of the night. Luckily we called the front desk and they sent maintenance to fix it. We slept really good. I do recommend that if you get a room with a kitchen to be cautious and bring your own cooking utensils. The cookware is shared by everyone so you have to go the front desk to get your cookware. Overall, we were pleased with our stay.

review.title: Comfortable 1-night layover
review.reviewText:
Free shuttle to/from SFO. You must call ahead for pick up. I waited less than 15 minutes for the shuttle, enough time for me to pick up my bag & walk over to the curb. Morning shuttle to SFO was on time.
Close to SFO, about 10-15 minute drive (shuttle bus also picks up guests from other hotels). From the drive, I can see that the hotel is nearby a few restaurants and some are within walking distance.
Lobby is small, but it is nice and bright.
I think there is a total of 3 floors. I was put in a 2nd floor room.
Nice size room with a kitchen. Kitchen is a good size that fits a stove, oven, microwave, fridge, and a sink. Kitchen does not have any utensils and have fake cabinets (when you open the cabinet door, there's no storage space as they are there to hide ducts etc).
Comfortable king-sized bed.
Bathroom quite small and water pressure is ok, not the strongest.
Walls are thin. I could hear the next door guests even when they're talking at a normal conversational level. You could hear people walk by outside of your room and people chatting outside. I was lucky that when I was there, the guests were not noisy at all.
The floors are also thin. If you happen to have an upstairs neighbor who thumps a lot, I could imagine you would be able to hear the footsteps.
Free breakfast but it was horrible. I should've skipped it.
Requested a wake up call & received one.
Would stay here again the next time I have a layover.

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText: Always a pleasure staying here, very efficient and friendly staff, clean and quiet. Easy access to the S.F. Airport. Have recommended it to fellow travelers.

review.title: What a kind and wonderful staff especially Meki
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the rooms and gracious attitude of the staff

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Shuttle services were very nice and prompt! the Breakfast was pretty decent as well. The rooms are very roomy! We were surprised when we walked into our king size bedroom to find a coach in there as well. there was also a mini fridge and microwave which was nice as well.

review.title: Hotel will choose again
review.reviewText: Newer motel than the one that we chose last time in S.F. Room with microwave and refrigerator also we as outsiders. Overall, very good experience with this model.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Adequate breakfast. Reasonably comfortable bed. Good value. Reasonably convenient to SFO for access to San Francisco area, although several blocks from BART station.

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Very good hotel.worth more than what i paid.owners were very freindly,free parking,market near by,free breakfast.very satisfied.

review.title: Convenient overnight stay close to SFO
review.reviewText: Extremely friendly staff, very helpful in finding places to eat. Very nice breakfast buffet, and clean room. Convenient, close location to SFO with shuttle bus. Overall a very pleasant stay that is also affordable.

review.title: Worked well between SFO flights
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel at the last minute after returning from Europe when we were sure that our evening flight to SFO would arrive as scheduled. Our last flight home was the following morning so we just needed a clean and comfortable place to shower and sleep. La Quinta provided that and more. We did not have to wait long for the shuttle to the hotel and the night clerk took our reservation for the return shuttle the next morning which picked us up right on time. The included breakfast was quite adequate and the room rate reasonable. The bed was comfortable with good quality linens and our room was clean. For a longer stay the microwave and refrigerator would have been handy. I would choose this hotel again.

review.title: Worst La Quinta hotel in America
review.reviewText: Hotel was under construction, loud noises constantly, malfunctioning electric, unpleasant and unhelpful staff, no available parking, too many problems to list at once. Smoke alarm went off in middle of night for no reason. When I called front desk, was told to open the door until it stopped ringing - at 4am!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: LaQuinta Inn hotels are consistently good values. In addition, I like to support them because they are one of a few chains that accepts dogs and I have a small dog that I sometimes take along.

review.title: Not Impresssed
review.reviewText: This property was dirty and very run down.

review.title: Convenient for airport travelers
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and very convenient to the airport with frequent free airport shuttles. The front desk staff was very friendly and eager to help. The breakfast was very good - better than at most La Quintas. There is a restaurant on the grounds open for dinner, but you should know that it is Japanese. I had a very good udon soup. The only drawback was that my room was very near the road and there was some road noise, but it didn't interfere with my sleep - may bother some people.

review.title: Get to the "correct" La Quinta
review.reviewText: Once we arrived at the correct hotel everything was fine. However, it would be very important to note that there are two La Quinta hotels within a couple of miles of one another. We took a $50 car service ride from the Fishermans Wharf only to find out that we were dropped at the wrong La Quinta. Obviously I must assume some responsibility for this, but a reminder upon booking would have been greatly appreciated.

review.title: Convenient for travel from SFO
review.reviewText: They have a shuttle that runs 24 hours, which was great for our 6 am flight. The location is easily accessible to the airport and is a terrific value for the area. There isn't much to do near the airport, but there are plenty of drugstores and grocery stores nearby if needed. It is not the best hotel for relaxing because you can frequently hear people rolling by with their luggage just outside your door. I also don't think that this hotel would make the best base for touring San Francisco. It is much cheaper than anything you would find in the city, but dealing with the traffic in and out of the city would be a big hassle. The room was clean, the internet worked and the bed was comfortable. It was perfect for what we needed at the time. Nothing luxurious, but clean and functional. We will definitely stay here again the night before we leave out of SFO!

review.title: millbrae
review.reviewText: location was ok. parking was good. beds were a little hard. bedding was acceptable. bathroom could have used some upgrade. spa was out of order. breakfast was nice make ur own waffles. overall if I had to I would use them again.

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff. Wonderful breakfast. Comfortable and affordable room. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel for the airport
review.reviewText: La Quinta was a great hotel near the SF airport. We were looking for a hotel near the airport and we found a helpful and convenient one. Breakfast at the hotel in the morning was convenient for us to catch the early morning shuttle to the airport. Everyone in the hotel was friendly and helpful. I would stay again.

review.title: Noisy but workable.
review.reviewText: Thank god I had quiet neighbors. The hotel itself is very nice, clean and convenient but I could hear every word of the cell phone conversation in the next room. I was lucky they didn't have the TV blaring until 3am. Also, I could hear everything that "happened" in their bathroom. The hotel would benefit from some soundproofing.

review.title: Best Front Desk People
review.reviewText: The lady at the front desk was really helpful. She gave us directions to the airport rental car area, and helped us find the correct location for the shuttle service. We really appreciated the help.

review.title: Don't Go There
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very hard to find. It had just changed its name from Comfort Inn. And the cab could not find it. The pool was not heated and the Hot tub was being repaired and out of service. The ad said free in room internet but the internet was down.

review.title: No Thank You at Any Price
review.reviewText: During a week long trip up the California coast we spent four other nights at La Quinta Inns in different places and were very pleased at what we got for our money. So we assumed that the La Quinta name meant a certain standard. WRONG. Althought the room was large enough and had a fridge and micro, the carpet and the paint were so horrible it was almost impossible to get past that. The carpet was so threadbare and filthy that I could not put my bare feet on it, the paint was so dirty it was hard to sleep, Additionally, late at night individuals checked in next door and were extremely rouckous and noisy, hotel staff refused to addresss the situation in any way. The spa was out of order and did not appear it will be fixed anytime soon. Neighborhood was good and it was very close to SFO but there are others close, spend your money elsewhere.

review.title: OK for just overnight
review.reviewText: Name was changed to Quintos just last month, so we had some difficulty finding it (Comfort Inn) at first. Some of the electric outlets in our room does not work, so even though there is a microwave machine in the room, it won't turn on. It appears that renovation will occur in time, but things are a bit run down at the moment (Jan 2010).
